channel.title: Where can I upgrade my video card?
channel.description:
Well i was wondering where i can upgrade my video card..please help. Oh and can you please tell me where i can find it out i mean here are my system specs
Operating System: Microsoft Windows xp professinal (5.1, Build 2600) Processeor: Intel(R) Pentium(R) 4 CPU 3.00GHz (2cpu's) Memory: 1016mb ram DirectX Version: DirectX 9.0c
I need to upgrade it for my windows vista areo crusor
So please tell me where to upgrade my video card :o
I need to know what my video card is now so if u can tell me where to check it?

item.title: Where can I upgrade my video card?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Well you need to buy another video card. A place like www.newegg.com would have some that you can look through. Here’s a nice budget card (I’m pretty sure it’s Vista Aero compatible, not positive). You just have to look through some and find one that you want and can afford.

item.source: Where can I upgrade my video card?

item.title: Where can I upgrade my video card?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

You can’t “upgrade” your video card by downloading anything (not really, at least). You can just buy another video card. Maybe you’re referring to updating your drivers. Why would you need to upgrade your video card for a cursor anyway? That doesn’t make much sense.

To find out what video card you have, go to your start menu -> Run -> type “dxdiag”, then click on the “Display” tab.

By the way, no need to make a topic every time you have a question, you can just change the title of one of your other topics.

Read full topic
item.source: Where can I upgrade my video card?
